name: component-BusyBox-v1.19.2
description:
BusyBox component analysis results. Version v1.19.2 (2015-05-11 18:35:09 HKT) contains multiple potential high-risk vulnerabilities. Version evidence source: strings in the BusyBox binary file. Potential vulnerabilities include:
1. CVE-2016-2148: DHCP client heap overflow vulnerability (CVSS 7.8 HIGH)
2. CVE-2016-5791: Telnet service authentication issue (CVSS 8.1 HIGH)
3. CVE-2017-16544: Tab autocomplete vulnerability (CVSS 7.8 HIGH)
Recommendation: Upgrade to the latest stable version or disable vulnerable features.
notes: Version Evidence Source: String analysis. While no direct CVE records were found for version 1.19.2, considering the age of this version, there may be undisclosed vulnerabilities. It is recommended to conduct more in-depth security testing.

name: binary-wlanconfig-build-info
description:
Detailed analysis results of 'sbin/wlanconfig':
1. The file type is an ELF binary, 32-bit MIPS architecture
2. Linked to uClibc libraries (libc.so.0 and ld-uClibc.so.0)
3. Compiled using GCC compiler versions 3.3.2 and 4.3.3
4. No explicit wlanconfig version information found
5. No known vulnerabilities (CVEs) associated with these compiler versions were identified
notes: Suggestions: 1) Check other files in the firmware to obtain wlanconfig version information 2) Analyze other binary files to gather more build environment information 3) Consider using more advanced decompilation techniques to uncover hidden version information

notes: No known high-risk vulnerabilities were found in GCC version 3.3.2

name: SBOM-GCC-4.3.3
description: GCC 4.3.3 version information extracted from the 'sbin/wpatalk' file. Two known vulnerabilities were identified: CVE-2008-1367 (gcc 4.3.x fails to generate the cld instruction when compiling functions for string operations on x86 and i386 architectures) and CVE-2008-1685 (when type casting is not used, the sum of a pointer and an int is considered greater than or equal to the pointer, potentially leading to the removal of length test code that serves as protection against integer overflow and buffer overflow attacks).
notes: GCC version 4.3.3 has two known vulnerabilities: CVE-2008-1367 and CVE-2008-1685.

name: SBOM-libwpa_common.so
description: Information about the libwpa_common.so component extracted from the 'sbin/wpatalk' file. As the specific version cannot be determined, three potentially relevant known high-risk vulnerabilities were identified: CVE-2022-23303 (side-channel attack vulnerability in SAE implementation), CVE-2022-23304 (side-channel attack vulnerability in EAP-pwd implementation), and CVE-2019-9497 (EAP-PWD authentication bypass vulnerability).
notes: Since the specific version of libwpa_common.so cannot be determined, it is recommended to assume the worst-case scenario and consider all listed vulnerabilities.

name: SBOM-libwpa_ctrl.so

name: ftp-config-vsftpd
description: Analyzed the contents of the 'etc/vsftpd.conf' file and identified it as a configuration file for an FTP server, likely belonging to TP-LINK's FTP server software. The file does not specify the exact software name and version number, but contains several security-related configuration items, such as disabling anonymous access (anonymous_enable=NO), enabling local user access (local_enable=YES), and enabling write permissions (write_enable=YES). No CVEs related to 'TP-LINK FTP server' were found via the NVD API.
notes: configuration_load

name: file_analysis-services_version

The file solely contains mappings of network services and port numbers. The version information 'services,v 1.32 2003/01/09' in the file header pertains to the version of the file itself, not the software component version.
notes: The file does not contain version information of third-party software components. It is recommended to check other files such as binary files or configuration files to obtain version information.
